data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take your 4-steps, turn around, and then turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around to get back to the starting point. Taking 4 steps takes 4 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You will be back in the starting point if you return 7 steps and take 1 step. The answer: Yes.

Take 9 steps from the starting point. Take 5 steps. This is an incorrect way to do this. So, the answer is No.

The instructions only turn around and back and do not mean you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You step back to the starting point the same way one would start it. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. So, the answer is No.

The instructions take 6 steps to return to the starting point. The instructions take 8 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Keeping facing forward is required to progress forward. Whenever you are facing forward you will always have to take one step left. Performing multiple actions will force you to revert to one point in time. So, the answer is No.

To return to the starting point, you must take the same number of steps as the number of steps taken to come to. So, the answer is No.

If we always face forward, then we keep our head up and our feet forward, and at least one step backward while we are facing forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step is backward. When you are backward, the next step must be forward. There are 6 steps backward. To go backward, you must first go backward. If you are going right, you must first go right. Bringing in your right hand is positive if you are going left. It returns you to you starting point. A person returning from a forward motion is one who moves from the starting point forward. If you were facing left, you would take 2 steps left after you had taken 2 steps right. Thus, the answer is No.

Take the remaining 9 steps backward to get to the starting point. Take the rest of the 10 steps left to get back to the starting point. Take the 1st step backward to get back to the starting point. Take the next 2 steps, or whatever, to get left, and then the next step left to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Place your index finger on the edge of your left foot. Place your thumb on top of your right foot. Place your middle finger on the edge of your left foot. You start on the right side of the wall and your return point is on the right side. The first set of instructions takes you away from the starting point. The second set involves going back and taking 4 steps and 6 steps backward. You don' t have to take 4 steps backward to go back to the starting point. You can just take 5 steps right to get back to where you started. So, the answer is Yes.
